verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:1
verses.text: Apocrypha of the New Testament:  The Protevangelium of James.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:2
verses.text: The Birth of Mary the Holy Mother of God, and Very Glorious Mother of Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:3
verses.text: In the records of the twelve tribes of Israel was Joachim, a man rich exceedingly; and he brought his offerings double, saying:  There shall be of my superabundance to all the people, and there shall be the offering for my forgiveness to the Lord for a propitiation for me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:4
verses.text: For the great day of the Lord was at hand, and the sons of Israel were bringing their offerings.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:5
verses.text: And there stood over against him Rubim, saying:  It is not meet for thee first to bring thine offerings, because thou hast not made seed in Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:6
verses.text: And Joachim was exceedingly grieved, and went away to the registers of the twelve tribes of the people, saying:  I shall see the registers of the twelve tribes of Israel, as to whether I alone have not made seed in Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:7
verses.text: And he searched, and found that all the righteous had raised up seed in Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:8
verses.text: And he called to mind the patriarch Abraham, that in the last day God gave him a son Isaac.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:9
verses.text: And Joachim was exceedingly grieved, and did not come into the presence of his wife; but he retired to the desert, and there pitched his tent, and fasted forty days and forty nights, saying in himself:  I will not go down either for food or for drink until the Lord my God shall look upon me, and prayer shall be my food and drink.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:10
verses.text: And his wife Anna mourned in two mournings, and lamented in two lamentations, saying:  I shall bewail my widowhood; I shall bewail my childlessness.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:11
verses.text: And the great day of the Lord was at hand; and Judith her maid-servant said:  How long dost thou humiliate thy soul?  Behold, the great day of the Lord is at hand, and it is unlawful for thee to mourn.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:12
verses.text: But take this head-band, which the woman that made it gave to me; for it is not proper that I should wear it, because I am a maid-servant, and it has a royal appearance.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:13
verses.text: And Anna said:  Depart from me; for I have not done such things, and the Lord has brought me very low.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:14
verses.text: I fear that some wicked person has given it to thee, and thou hast come to make me a sharer in thy sin.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:15
verses.text: And Judith said:  Why should I curse thee, seeing that the Lord hath shut thy womb, so as not to give thee fruit in Israel?  And Anna was grieved exceedingly, and put off her garments of mourning, and cleaned her head, and put on her wedding garments, and about the ninth hour went down to the garden to walk.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:16
verses.text: And she saw a laurel, and sat under it, and prayed to the Lord, saying:  O God of our fathers, bless me and hear my prayer, as Thou didst bless the womb of Sarah, and didst give her a son Isaac.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:17
verses.text: And gazing towards the heaven, she saw a sparrow's nest in the laurel, and made a lamentation in herself, saying:  Alas! who begot me? and what womb produced me? because I have become a curse in the presence of the sons of Israel, and I have been reproached, and they have driven me in derision out of the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:18
verses.text: Alas! to what have I been likened?  I am not like the fowls of the heaven, because even the fowls of the heaven are productive before Thee, O Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:19
verses.text: Alas! to what have I been likened?  I am not like the beasts of the earth, because even the beasts of the earth are productive before Thee, O Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:20
verses.text: Alas! to what have I been likened?  I am not like these waters, because even these waters are productive before Thee, O Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:21
verses.text: Alas! to what have I been likened?  I am not like this earth, because even the earth bringeth forth its fruits in season, and blesseth Thee, O Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:22
verses.text: And, behold, an angel of the Lord stood by, saying:  Anna, Anna, the Lord hath heard thy prayer, and thou shalt conceive, and shall bring forth; and thy seed shall be spoken of in all the world.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:23
verses.text: And Anna said:  As the Lord my God liveth, if I beget either male or female, I will bring it as a gift to the Lord my God; and it shall minister to Him in holy things all the days of its life.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:24
verses.text: And, behold, two angels came, saying to her:  Behold, Joachim thy husband is coming with his flocks.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:25
verses.text: For an angel of the Lord went down to him, saying:  Joachim, Joachim, the Lord God hath heard thy prayer.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:26
verses.text: Go down hence; for, behold, thy wife Anna shall conceive.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:27
verses.text: And Joachim went down and called his shepherds, saying:  Bring me hither ten she-lambs without spot or blemish, and they shall be for the Lord my God; and bring me twelve tender calves, and they shall be for the priests and the elders; and a hundred goats for all the people.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:28
verses.text: And, behold, Joachim came with his flocks; and Anna stood by the gate, and saw Joachim coming, and she ran and hung upon his neck, saying:  Now I know that the Lord God hath blessed me exceedingly; for, behold the widow no longer a widow, and I the childless shall conceive.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:29
verses.text: And Joachim rested the first day in his house.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:30
verses.text: And on the following day he brought his offerings, saying in himself:  If the Lord God has been rendered gracious to me, the plate on the priest's forehead will make it manifest to me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:31
verses.text: And Joachim brought his offerings, and observed attentively the priest's plate when he went up to the altar of the Lord, and he saw no sin in himself.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:32
verses.text: And Joachim said:  Now I know that the Lord has been gracious unto me, and has remitted all my sins.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:33
verses.text: And he went down from the temple of the Lord justified, and departed to his own house.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:34
verses.text: And her months were fulfilled, and in the ninth month Anna brought forth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:35
verses.text: And she said to the midwife:  What have I brought forth? and she said:  A girl.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:36
verses.text: And said Anna:  My soul has been magnified this day.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:37
verses.text: And she laid her down.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:38
verses.text: And the days having been fulfilled, Anna was purified, and gave the breast to the child, and called her name Mary.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:39
verses.text: And the child grew strong day by day; and when she was six months old, her mother set her on the ground to try whether she could stand, and she walked seven steps and came into her bosom; and she snatched her up, saying:  As the Lord my God liveth, thou shalt not walk on this earth until I bring thee into the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:40
verses.text: And she made a sanctuary in her bed-chamber, and allowed nothing common or unclean to pass through her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:41
verses.text: And she called the undefiled daughters of the Hebrews, and they led her astray.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:42
verses.text: And when she was a year old, Joachim made a great feast, and invited the priests, and the scribes, and the elders, and all the people of Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:43
verses.text: And Joachim brought the child to the priests; and they blessed her, saying:  O God of our fathers, bless this child, and give her an everlasting name to be named in all generations.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:44
verses.text: And all the people said:  So be it, so be it, amen.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:45
verses.text: And he brought her to the chief priests; and they blessed her, saying:  O God most high, look upon this child, and bless her with the utmost blessing, which shall be for ever.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:46
verses.text: And her mother snatched her up, and took her into the sanctuary of her bed-chamber, and gave her the breast.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:47
verses.text: And Anna made a song to the Lord God, saying:  I will sing a song to the Lord my God, for He hath looked upon me, and hath taken away the reproach of mine enemies; and the Lord hath given the fruit of His righteousness, singular in its kind, and richly endowed before Him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:48
verses.text: Who will tell the sons of Rubim that Anna gives suck?  Hear, hear, ye twelve tribes of Israel, that Anna gives suck.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:49
verses.text: And she laid her to rest in the bed-chamber of her sanctuary, and went out and ministered unto them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:50
verses.text: And when the supper was ended, they went down rejoicing, and glorifying the God of Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:51
verses.text: And her months were added to the child.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:52
verses.text: And the child was two years old, and Joachim said:  Let us take her up to the temple of the Lord, that we may pay the vow that we have vowed, lest perchance the Lord send to us, and our offering be not received.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:53
verses.text: And Anna said:  Let us wait for the third year, in order that the child may not seek for father or mother.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:54
verses.text: And Joachim said:  So let us wait.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:55
verses.text: And the child was three years old, and Joachim said:  Invite the daughters of the Hebrews that are undefiled, and let them take each a lamp, and let them stand with the lamps burning, that the child may not turn back, and her heart be captivated from the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:56
verses.text: And they did so until they went up into the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:57
verses.text: And the priest received her, and kissed her, and blessed her, saying:  The Lord has magnified thy name in all generations.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:58
verses.text: In thee, on the last of the days, the Lord will manifest His redemption to the sons of Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:59
verses.text: And he set her down upon the third step of the altar, and the Lord God sent grace upon her; and she danced with her feet, and all the house of Israel loved her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:60
verses.text: And her parents went down marvelling, and praising the Lord God, because the child had not turned back.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:61
verses.text: And Mary was in the temple of the Lord as if she were a dove that dwelt there, and she received food from the hand of an angel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:62
verses.text: And when she was twelve years old there was held a council of the priests, saying:  Behold, Mary has reached the age of twelve years in the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:63
verses.text: What then shall we do with her, lest perchance she defile the sanctuary of the Lord?  And they said to the high priest:  Thou standest by the altar of the Lord; go in, and pray concerning her; and whatever the Lord shall manifest unto thee, that also will we do.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:64
verses.text: And the high priest went in, taking the robe with the twelve bells into the holy of holies; and he prayed concerning her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:65
verses.text: And behold an angel of the Lord stood by him, saying unto him:  Zacharias, Zacharias, go out and assemble the widowers of the people, and let them bring each his rod; and to whomsoever the Lord shall show a sign, his wife shall she be.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:66
verses.text: And the heralds went out through all the circuit of Judaea, and the trumpet of the Lord sounded, and all ran.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:67
verses.text: And Joseph, throwing away his axe, went out to meet them; and when they had assembled, they went away to the high priest, taking with them their rods.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:68
verses.text: And he, taking the rods of all of them, entered into the temple, and prayed; and having ended his prayer, he took the rods and came out, and gave them to them:  but there was no sign in them, and Joseph took his rod last; and, behold, a dove came out of the rod, and flew upon Joseph's head.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:69
verses.text: And the priest said to Joseph, Thou hast been chosen by lot to take into thy keeping the virgin of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:70
verses.text: But Joseph refused, saying:  I have children, and I am an old man, and she is a young girl.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:71
verses.text: I am afraid lest I become a laughing-stock to the sons of Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:72
verses.text: And the priest said to Joseph:  Fear the Lord thy God, and remember what the Lord did to Dathan, and Abiram, and Korah; how the earth opened, and they were swallowed up on account of their contradiction.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:73
verses.text: And now fear, O Joseph, lest the same things happen in thy house.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:74
verses.text: And Joseph was afraid, and took her into his keeping.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:75
verses.text: And Joseph said to Mary:  Behold, I have received thee from the temple of the Lord; and now I leave thee in my house, and go away to build my buildings, and I shall come to thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:76
verses.text: The Lord will protect thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:77
verses.text: And there was a council of the priests, saying:  Let us make a veil for the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:78
verses.text: And the priest said:  Call to me the undefiled virgins of the family of David.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:79
verses.text: And the officers went away, and sought, and found seven virgins.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:80
verses.text: And the priest remembered the child Mary, that she was of the family of David, and undefiled before God.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:81
verses.text: And the officers went away and brought her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:82
verses.text: And they brought them into the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:83
verses.text: And the priest said:  Choose for me by lot who shall spin the gold, and the white, and the fine linen, and the silk, and the blue, and the scarlet, and the true purple.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:84
verses.text: And the true purple and the scarlet fell to the lot of Mary, and she took them, and went away to her house.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:85
verses.text: And at that time Zacharias was dumb, and Samuel was in his place until the time that Zacharias spake.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:86
verses.text: And Mary took the scarlet, and span it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:87
verses.text: And she took the pitcher, and went out to fill it with water.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:88
verses.text: And, behold, a voice saying:  Hail, thou who hast received grace; the Lord is with thee; blessed art thou among women!  And she looked round, on the right hand and on the left, to see whence this voice came.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:89
verses.text: And she went away, trembling, to her house, and put down the pitcher; and taking the purple, she sat down on her seat, and drew it out.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:90
verses.text: And, behold, an angel of the Lord stood before her, saying:  Fear not, Mary; for thou hast found grace before the Lord of all, and thou shalt conceive, according to His word.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:91
verses.text: And she hearing, reasoned with herself, saying:  Shall I conceive by the Lord, the living God? and shall I bring forth as every woman brings forth?  And the angel of the Lord said:  Not so, Mary; for the power of the Lord shall overshadow thee:  wherefore also that holy thing which shall be born of thee shall be called the Son of the Most High.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:92
verses.text: And thou shalt call His name Jesus, for He shall save His people from their sins.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:93
verses.text: And Mary said:  Behold, the servant of the Lord before His face:  let it be unto me according to thy word.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:94
verses.text: And she made the purple and the scarlet, and took them to the priest.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:95
verses.text: And the priest blessed her, and said:  Mary, the Lord God hath magnified thy name, and thou shalt be blessed in all the generations of the earth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:96
verses.text: And Mary, with great joy, went away to Elizabeth her kinswoman, and knocked at the door.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:97
verses.text: And when Elizabeth heard her, she threw away the scarlet, and ran to the door, and opened it; and seeing Mary, she blessed her, and said:  Whence is this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me? for, behold, that which is in me leaped and blessed thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:98
verses.text: But Mary had forgotten the mysteries of which the archangel Gabriel had spoken, and gazed up into heaven, and said:  Who am I, O Lord, that all the generations of the earth should bless me?  And she remained three months with Elizabeth; and day by day she grew bigger.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:99
verses.text: And Mary being afraid, went away to her own house, and hid herself from the sons of Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:100
verses.text: And she was sixteen years old when these mysteries happened.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:101
verses.text: And she was in her sixth month; and, behold, Joseph came back from his building, and, entering into his house, he discovered that she was big with child.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:102
verses.text: And he smote his face, and threw himself on the ground upon the sackcloth, and wept bitterly, saying:  With what face shall I look upon the Lord my God? and what prayer shall I make about this maiden? because I received her a virgin out of the temple of the Lord, and I have not watched over her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:103
verses.text: Who is it that has hunted me down?  Who has done this evil thing in my house, and defiled the virgin?  Has not the history of Adam been repeated in me?  For just as Adam was in the hour of his singing praise, and the serpent came, and found Eve alone, and completely deceived her, so it has happened to me also.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:104
verses.text: And Joseph stood up from the sackcloth, and called Mary, and said to her:  O thou who hast been cared for by God, why hast thou done this and forgotten the Lord thy God?  Why hast thou brought low thy soul, thou that wast brought up in the holy of holies, and that didst receive food from the hand of an angel?  And she wept bitterly, saying:  I am innocent, and have known no man.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:105
verses.text: And Joseph said to her:  Whence then is that which is in thy womb?  And she said:  As the Lord my God liveth, I do not know whence it is to me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:106
verses.text: And Joseph was greatly afraid, and retired from her, and considered what he should do in regard to her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:107
verses.text: And Joseph said:  If I conceal her sin, I find myself fighting against the law of the Lord; and if I expose her to the sons of Israel, I am afraid lest that which is in her be from an angel, and I shall be found giving up innocent blood to the doom of death.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:108
verses.text: What then shall I do with her?  I will put her away from me secretly.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:109
verses.text: And night came upon him; and, behold, an angel of the Lord appears to him in a dream, saying:  Be not afraid for this maiden, for that which is in her is of the Holy Spirit; and she will bring forth a Son, and thou shalt call His name Jesus, for He will save His people from their sins.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:110
verses.text: And Joseph arose from sleep, and glorified the God of Israel, who had given him this grace; and he kept her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:111
verses.text: And Annas the scribe came to him, and said:  Why hast thou not appeared in our assembly?  And Joseph said to him:  Because I was weary from my journey, and rested the first day.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:112
verses.text: And he turned, and saw that Mary was with child.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:113
verses.text: And he ran away to the priest, and said to him:  Joseph, whom thou didst vouch for, has committed a grievous crime.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:114
verses.text: And the priest said:  How so?  And he said:  He has defiled the virgin whom he received out of the temple of the Lord, and has married her by stealth, and has not revealed it to the sons of Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:115
verses.text: And the priest answering, said:  Has Joseph done this?  Then said Annas the scribe:  Send officers, and thou wilt find the virgin with child.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:116
verses.text: And the officers went away, and found it as he had said; and they brought her along with Joseph to the tribunal.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:117
verses.text: And the priest said:  Mary, why hast thou done this? and why hast thou brought thy soul low, and forgotten the Lord thy God?  Thou that wast reared in the holy of holies, and that didst receive food from the hand of an angel, and didst hear the hymns, and didst dance before Him, why hast thou done this?  And she wept bitterly, saying:  As the Lord my God liveth, I am pure before Him, and know not a man.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:118
verses.text: And the priest said to Joseph:  Why hast thou done this?  And Joseph said:  As the Lord liveth, I am pure concerning her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:119
verses.text: Then said the priest:  Bear not false witness, but speak the truth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:120
verses.text: Thou hast married her by stealth, and hast not revealed it to the sons of Israel, and hast not bowed thy head under the strong hand, that thy seed might be blessed.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:121
verses.text: And Joseph was silent.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:122
verses.text: And the priest said:  Give up the virgin whom thou didst receive out of the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:123
verses.text: And Joseph burst into tears.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:124
verses.text: And the priest said:  I will give you to drink of the water of the ordeal of the Lord, and He shall make manifest your sins in your eyes.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:125
verses.text: And the priest took the water, and gave Joseph to drink and sent him away to the hill-country; and he returned unhurt.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:126
verses.text: And he gave to Mary also to drink, and sent her away to the hill-country; and she returned unhurt.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:127
verses.text: And all the people wondered that sin did not appear in them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:128
verses.text: And the priest said:  If the Lord God has not made manifest your sins, neither do I judge you.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:129
verses.text: And he sent them away.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:130
verses.text: And Joseph took Mary, and went away to his own house, rejoicing and glorifying the God of Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:131
verses.text: And there was an order from the Emperor Augustus, that all in Bethlehem of Judaea should be enrolled.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:132
verses.text: And Joseph said:  I shall enrol my sons, but what shall I do with this maiden?  How shall I enrol her?  As my wife?  I am ashamed.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:133
verses.text: As my daughter then?  But all the sons of Israel know that she is not my daughter.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:134
verses.text: The day of the Lord shall itself bring it to pass as the Lord will.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:135
verses.text: And he saddled the ass, and set her upon it; and his son led it, and Joseph followed.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:136
verses.text: And when they had come within three miles, Joseph turned and saw her sorrowful; and he said to himself:  Likely that which is in her distresses her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:137
verses.text: And again Joseph turned and saw her laughing.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:138
verses.text: And he said to her:  Mary, how is it that I see in thy face at one time laughter, at another sorrow?  And Mary said to Joseph:  Because I see two peoples with my eyes; the one weeping and lamenting, and the other rejoicing and exulting.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:139
verses.text: And they came into the middle of the road, and Mary said to him:  Take me down from off the ass, for that which is in me presses to come forth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:140
verses.text: And he took her down from off the ass, and said to her:  Whither shall I lead thee, and cover thy disgrace? for the place is desert.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:141
verses.text: And he found a cave there, and led her into it; and leaving his two sons beside her, he went out to seek a widwife in the district of Bethlehem.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:142
verses.text: And I Joseph was walking, and was not walking; and I looked up into the sky, and saw the sky astonished; and I looked up to the pole of the heavens, and saw it standing, and the birds of the air keeping still.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:143
verses.text: And I looked down upon the earth, and saw a trough lying, and work-people reclining: and their hands were in the trough.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:144
verses.text: And those that were eating did not eat, and those that were rising did not carry it up, and those that were conveying anything to their mouths did not convey it; but the faces of all were looking upwards.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:145
verses.text: And I saw the sheep walking, and the sheep stood still; and the shepherd raised his hand to strike them, and his hand remained up.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:146
verses.text: And I looked upon the current of the river, and I saw the mouths of the kids resting on the water and not drinking, and all things in a moment were driven from their course.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:147
verses.text: And I saw a woman coming down from the hill-country, and she said to me:  O man, whither art thou going?  And I said:  I am seeking an Hebrew midwife.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:148
verses.text: And she answered and said unto me:  Art thou of Israel?  And I said to her:  Yes.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:149
verses.text: And she said:  And who is it that is bringing forth in the cave?  And I said:  A woman betrothed to me.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:150
verses.text: And she said to me:  Is she not thy wife?  And I said to her:  It is Mary that was reared in the temple of the Lord, and I obtained her by lot as my wife.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:151
verses.text: And yet she is not my wife, but has conceived of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:152
verses.text: And the widwife said to him:  Is this true?  And Joseph said to her:  Come and see.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:153
verses.text: And the midwife went away with him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:154
verses.text: And they stood in the place of the cave, and behold a luminous cloud overshadowed the cave.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:155
verses.text: And the midwife said:  My soul has been magnified this day, because mine eyes have seen strange things—because salvation has been brought forth to Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:156
verses.text: And immediately the cloud disappeared out of the cave, and a great light shone in the cave, so that the eyes could not bear it.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:157
verses.text: And in a little that light gradually decreased, until the infant appeared, and went and took the breast from His mother Mary.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:158
verses.text: And the midwife cried out, and said:  This is a great day to me, because I have seen this strange sight.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:159
verses.text: And the midwife went forth out of the cave, and Salome met her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:160
verses.text: And she said to her:  Salome, Salome, I have a strange sight to relate to thee:  a virgin has brought forth—a thing which her nature admits not of.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:161
verses.text: Then said Salome:  As the Lord my God liveth, unless I thrust in my finger, and search the parts, I will not believe that a virgin has brought forth.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:162
verses.text: And the midwife went in, and said to Mary:  Show thyself; for no small controversy has arisen about thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:163
verses.text: And Salome put in her finger, and cried out, and said:  Woe is me for mine iniquity and mine unbelief, because I have tempted the living God; and, behold, my hand is dropping off as if burned with fire.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:164
verses.text: And she bent her knees before the Lord, saying:  O God of my fathers, remember that I am the seed of Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob; do not make a show of me to the sons of Israel, but restore me to the poor; for Thou knowest, O Lord, that in Thy name I have performed my services, and that I have received my reward at Thy hand.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:165
verses.text: And, behold, an angel of the Lord stood by her, saying to her:  Salome, Salome, the Lord hath heard thee.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:166
verses.text: Put thy hand to the infant, and carry it, and thou wilt have safety and joy.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:167
verses.text: And Salome went and carried it, saying:  I will worship Him, because a great King has been born to Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:168
verses.text: And, behold, Salome was immediately cured, and she went forth out of the cave justified.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:169
verses.text: And behold a voice saying:  Salome, Salome, tell not the strange things thou hast seen, until the child has come into Jerusalem.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:170
verses.text: And, behold, Joseph was ready to go into Judaea.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:171
verses.text: And there was a great commotion in Bethlehem of Judaea, for Magi came, saying:  Where is he that is born king of the Jews? for we have seen his star in the east, and have come to worship him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:172
verses.text: And when Herod heard, he was much disturbed, and sent officers to the Magi.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:173
verses.text: And he sent for the priests, and examined them, saying:  How is it written about the Christ? where is He to be born?  And they said:  In Bethlehem of Judaea, for so it is written.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:174
verses.text: And he sent them away.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:175
verses.text: And he examined the Magi, saying to them:  What sign have you seen in reference to the king that has been born?  And the Magi said:  We have seen a star of great size shining among these stars, and obscuring their light, so that the stars did not appear; and we thus knew that a king has been born to Israel, and we have come to worship him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:176
verses.text: And Herod said:  Go and seek him; and if you find him, let me know, in order that I also may go and worship him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:177
verses.text: And the Magi went out.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:178
verses.text: And, behold, the star which they had seen in the east went before them until they came to the cave, and it stood over the top of the cave.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:179
verses.text: And the Magi saw the infant with His mother Mary; and they brought forth from their bag gold, and frankincense, and myrrh.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:180
verses.text: And having been warned by the angel not to go into Judaea, they went into their own country by another road.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:181
verses.text: And when Herod knew that he had been mocked by the Magi, in a rage he sent murderers, saying to them:  Slay the children from two years old and under.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:182
verses.text: And Mary, having heard that the children were being killed, was afraid, and took the infant and swaddled Him, and put Him into an ox-stall.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:183
verses.text: And Elizabeth, having heard that they were searching for John, took him and went up into the hill-country, and kept looking where to conceal him.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:184
verses.text: And there was no place of concealment.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:185
verses.text: And Elizabeth, groaning with a loud voice, says:  O mountain of God, receive mother and child.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:186
verses.text: And immediately the mountain was cleft, and received her.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:187
verses.text: And a light shone about them, for an angel of the Lord was with them, watching over them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:188
verses.text: And Herod searched for John, and sent officers to Zacharias, saying:  Where hast thou hid thy son?  And he, answering, said to them:  I am the servant of God in holy things, and I sit constantly in the temple of the Lord:  I do not know where my son is.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:189
verses.text: And the officers went away, and reported all these things to Herod.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:190
verses.text: And Herod was enraged, and said:  His son is destined to be king over Israel.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:191
verses.text: And he sent to him again, saying:  Tell the truth; where is thy son? for thou knowest that thy life is in my hand.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:192
verses.text: And Zacharias said:  I am God's martyr, if thou sheddest my blood; for the Lord will receive my spirit, because thou sheddest innocent blood at the vestibule of the temple of the Lord.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:193
verses.text: And Zacharias was murdered about daybreak.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:194
verses.text: And the sons of Israel did not know that he had been murdered.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:195
verses.text: But at the hour of the salutation the priests went away, and Zacharias did not come forth to meet them with a blessing, according to his custom.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:196
verses.text: And the priests stood waiting for Zacharias to salute him at the prayer, and to glorify the Most High.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:197
verses.text: And he still delaying, they were all afraid.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:198
verses.text: But one of them ventured to go in, and he saw clotted blood beside the altar; and he heard a voice saying:  Zacharias has been murdered, and his blood shall not be wiped up until his avenger come.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:199
verses.text: And hearing this saying, he was afraid, and went out and told it to the priests.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:200
verses.text: And they ventured in, and saw what had happened; and the fretwork of the temple made a wailing noise, and they rent their clothes from the top even to the bottom.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:201
verses.text: And they found not his body, but they found his blood turned into stone.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:202
verses.text: And they were afraid, and went out and reported to the people that Zacharias had been murdered.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:203
verses.text: And all the tribes of the people heard, and mourned, and lamented for him three days and three nights.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:204
verses.text: And after the three days, the priests consulted as to whom they should put in his place; and the lot fell upon Simeon.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:205
verses.text: For it was he who had been warned by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death until he should see the Christ in the flesh.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:206
verses.text: And I James that wrote this history in Jerusalem, a commotion having arisen when Herod died, withdrew myself to the wilderness until the commotion in Jerusalem ceased, glorifying the Lord God, who had given me the gift and the wisdom to write this history.

verses.name: Apocrypha: The Protevangelium of James 1:207
verses.text: And grace shall be with them that fear our Lord Jesus Christ, to whom be glory to ages of ages,  Amen.
